meanings.definition: A large building where goods are stored for distribution.
meanings.sent1: The warehouses in our town hold many products for sale.
meanings.sent2: The company ships its products to various warehouses across the country.
meanings.sent3: The warehouses were so full that they seemed to be bursting at the seams!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a warehouse, storing memories of days gone by.
meanings.sent5: The image of the warehouses towering over the city skyline was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To store goods in a warehouse.
meanings.sent1: We need to warehouses these items before they are shipped out.
meanings.sent2: They warehouses all their excess inventory in a secure facility.
meanings.sent3: He warehouses his collection of vintage toys in the attic.
meanings.sent4: She warehouses her emotions deep inside, never letting them show.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully warehouses the fresh produce to maintain its quality.
